clinical_study.brief_title: The Mechanical Properties of Burned Muscles
clinical_study.official_title: The Investigation of Muscle Mechanical Properties in Burned Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: The investigate of mechanical properties of muscles in burned patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The hypermetabolic response to severe burn is characterized by muscle protein catabolism. Current opinion states that the hypermetabolic state resolves soon after complete wound closure. Clinically, we have witnessed that burned patient appear to be hypermetabolic and catabolic long after full healing of their wounds. Our goal in this study was to determine muscle mechanical properties (tone, stiffness and elasticity) after burn.

primary_outcome.description: Myotonometric measurement was used to determine for muscle stiffness. Device has a probe that creates constant pre-excitations and generates short-term, low-force mechanical stimulations over skin. The stimulations induce damped natural oscillations in the tissue and the myoton device records these oscillations with an accelerometer. Muscle tone, elasticity, and stiffness are calculated separately by the device.

Muscle tone, elasticity, and stiffness are calculated separately by the device.

intervention.description: Myotonometric assessment can predict the muscle stiffness, tone and elasticity
